trans-unit.source: API Apps overview
trans-unit.target: API Apps overview

trans-unit.source: Learn why Azure App Service is the best platform for developing, publishing, and hosting RESTful APIs.
trans-unit.target: Learn why Azure App Service is the best platform for developing, publishing, and hosting RESTful APIs.

trans-unit.source: API Apps overview
trans-unit.target: API Apps overview

trans-unit.source: API Apps is one of four app types offered by [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).
trans-unit.target: API Apps is one of four app types offered by [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).

trans-unit.source: [App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md) is a fully managed platform that brings a rich set of capabilities to web, mobile and integration scenarios.
trans-unit.target: [App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md) is a fully managed platform that brings a rich set of capabilities to web, mobile and integration scenarios.

trans-unit.source: API Apps in App Service offer features that make it easier to build, host, and consume APIs in the cloud and on-premises.
trans-unit.target: API Apps in App Service offer features that make it easier to build, host, and consume APIs in the cloud and on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Deploy your API as an API app in App Service and benefit from enterprise grade security, simple access control, hybrid connectivity, automatic SDK generation, and seamless integration with [Logic Apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: Deploy your API as an API app in App Service and benefit from enterprise grade security, simple access control, hybrid connectivity, automatic SDK generation, and seamless integration with [Logic Apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Why API Apps?
trans-unit.target: Why API Apps?

trans-unit.source: API Apps provides the following features:
trans-unit.target: API Apps provides the following features:

trans-unit.source: **Easy consumption** - Integrated support for [Swagger API metadata](#concepts) makes your APIs easily consumable by a variety of clients.
trans-unit.target: **Easy consumption** - Integrated support for [Swagger API metadata](#concepts) makes your APIs easily consumable by a variety of clients.

trans-unit.source: Automatically generate client code for your APIs in a variety of languages including C#, Java, and Javascript.
trans-unit.target: Automatically generate client code for your APIs in a variety of languages including C#, Java, and Javascript.

trans-unit.source: Easily configure [CORS](#concepts) without changing your code.
trans-unit.target: Easily configure [CORS](#concepts) without changing your code.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [App Service API Apps metadata for API discovery and code generation](app-service-api-metadata.md) and [Consume an API app from JavaScript using CORS](app-service-api-cors-consume-javascript.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [App Service API Apps metadata for API discovery and code generation](app-service-api-metadata.md) and [Consume an API app from JavaScript using CORS](app-service-api-cors-consume-javascript.md).

trans-unit.source: **Simple access control** - Protect an API app from unauthenticated access with no changes to your code.
trans-unit.target: **Simple access control** - Protect an API app from unauthenticated access with no changes to your code.

trans-unit.source: Built-in authentication services secure APIs for access by other services or by clients representing users.
trans-unit.target: Built-in authentication services secure APIs for access by other services or by clients representing users.

trans-unit.source: Supported identity providers include Azure Active Directory and third-party providers such as Facebook and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: Supported identity providers include Azure Active Directory and third-party providers such as Facebook and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: Clients can use Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) or the Mobile Apps SDK.
trans-unit.target: Clients can use Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) or the Mobile Apps SDK.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Expanding App Service authentication / authorization](/blog/announcing-app-service-authentication-authorization/) and [App Service API Apps - What's changed](app-service-api-whats-changed.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Expanding App Service authentication / authorization](/blog/announcing-app-service-authentication-authorization/) and [App Service API Apps - What's changed](app-service-api-whats-changed.md).

trans-unit.source: **Visual Studio integration** - Dedicated tools in Visual Studio streamline the work of creating, deploying, consuming, debugging, and managing API apps.
trans-unit.target: **Visual Studio integration** - Dedicated tools in Visual Studio streamline the work of creating, deploying, consuming, debugging, and managing API apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Announcing the Azure SDK 2.8.1 for .NET](/blog/announcing-azure-sdk-2-8-1-for-net/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Announcing the Azure SDK 2.8.1 for .NET](/blog/announcing-azure-sdk-2-8-1-for-net/).

trans-unit.source: **Integration with Logic Apps** - API apps that you create can be consumed by [App Service Logic Apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: **Integration with Logic Apps** - API apps that you create can be consumed by [App Service Logic Apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn how in [Using your custom API hosted on App Service with Logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-custom-hosted-api.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how in [Using your custom API hosted on App Service with Logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-custom-hosted-api.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about ongoing changes in how API Apps integrates with Logic Apps, see [App Service API Apps - What's changed](app-service-api-whats-changed.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about ongoing changes in how API Apps integrates with Logic Apps, see [App Service API Apps - What's changed](app-service-api-whats-changed.md).

trans-unit.source: **Bring your existing API as-is** - You don't have to change any of the code in your existing APIs to take advantage of API Apps features -- just deploy your code to an API app.
trans-unit.target: **Bring your existing API as-is** - You don't have to change any of the code in your existing APIs to take advantage of API Apps features -- just deploy your code to an API app.

trans-unit.source: Your API can use any language or framework supported by App Service, including ASP.NET and C#, Java, PHP, Node.js and Python.
trans-unit.target: Your API can use any language or framework supported by App Service, including ASP.NET and C#, Java, PHP, Node.js and Python.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the features offered by API Apps, Web Apps, and Mobile Apps are interchangeable.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the features offered by API Apps, Web Apps, and Mobile Apps are interchangeable.

trans-unit.source: This means that an instance of API Apps can take advantage of features for web and mobile development and hosting that Web Apps and Mobile Apps offer.
trans-unit.target: This means that an instance of API Apps can take advantage of features for web and mobile development and hosting that Web Apps and Mobile Apps offer.

trans-unit.source: The reverse is also true: for example, you can use a web app to host an API and still take advantage of Swagger metadata for client code generation and CORS for cross-domain browser access.
trans-unit.target: The reverse is also true: for example, you can use a web app to host an API and still take advantage of Swagger metadata for client code generation and CORS for cross-domain browser access.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Web Apps overview](../app-service-web/app-service-web-overview.md) and [Mobile Apps overview](../app-service-mobile/app-service-mobile-value-prop.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Web Apps overview](../app-service-web/app-service-web-overview.md) and [Mobile Apps overview](../app-service-mobile/app-service-mobile-value-prop.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use [Azure API Management](../api-management/api-management-key-concepts.md) to control client access to APIs that are hosted by App Service API Apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use [Azure API Management](../api-management/api-management-key-concepts.md) to control client access to APIs that are hosted by App Service API Apps.

trans-unit.source: While API Apps provides authentication services, there are other access management features it does not offer which API Management does offer, such as endpoint consolidation and throttling.
trans-unit.target: While API Apps provides authentication services, there are other access management features it does not offer which API Management does offer, such as endpoint consolidation and throttling.

trans-unit.source: API Apps concepts
trans-unit.target: API Apps concepts

trans-unit.source: **Swagger** - A framework for documentation and discovery of a RESTful API, used by default in API Apps.
trans-unit.target: **Swagger** - A framework for documentation and discovery of a RESTful API, used by default in API Apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [http://swagger.io/](http://swagger.io/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [http://swagger.io/](http://swagger.io/).

trans-unit.source: **Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)** - A mechanism that allows JavaScript running in a browser to make calls to an API hosted on a different domain than the web page was loaded from.
trans-unit.target: **Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)** - A mechanism that allows JavaScript running in a browser to make calls to an API hosted on a different domain than the web page was loaded from.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Consume an API app from JavaScript using CORS](app-service-api-cors-consume-javascript.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Consume an API app from JavaScript using CORS](app-service-api-cors-consume-javascript.md).

trans-unit.source: **Trigger** - A REST API that [logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md) can call to initiate a workflow process when a certain condition is met.
trans-unit.target: **Trigger** - A REST API that [logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md) can call to initiate a workflow process when a certain condition is met.

trans-unit.source: For example, an API app could provide a method that the logic app calls periodically to look for a certain phrase in a Twitter feed.
trans-unit.target: For example, an API app could provide a method that the logic app calls periodically to look for a certain phrase in a Twitter feed.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [API app triggers](app-service-api-dotnet-triggers.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [API app triggers](app-service-api-dotnet-triggers.md).

trans-unit.source: **Action** - A REST API that [logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md) can call to process data after a workflow has been started by a trigger.
trans-unit.target: **Action** - A REST API that [logic apps](../app-service-logic/app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md) can call to process data after a workflow has been started by a trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, an API app could provide a method that the logic app calls to respond to a tweet found by the Twitter trigger.
trans-unit.target: For example, an API app could provide a method that the logic app calls to respond to a tweet found by the Twitter trigger.

trans-unit.source: Actions are API methods that are exposed by a Swagger API definition.
trans-unit.target: Actions are API methods that are exposed by a Swagger API definition.

trans-unit.source: Getting started
trans-unit.target: Getting started

trans-unit.source: To get started with API apps, follow the [Get started with API Apps](app-service-api-dotnet-get-started.md) tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To get started with API apps, follow the [Get started with API Apps](app-service-api-dotnet-get-started.md) tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To see a list of known issues with API Apps, see [the API Apps known issues forum post](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/7f8b42f2-ac0d-48b8-a35e-3b4934e1c25e/api-app-known-issues?forum=AzureAPIApps).
trans-unit.target: To see a list of known issues with API Apps, see [the API Apps known issues forum post](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/7f8b42f2-ac0d-48b8-a35e-3b4934e1c25e/api-app-known-issues?forum=AzureAPIApps).

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see [Azure App Service](../app-service/app-service-value-prop-what-is.md).
